questions.question: Explain Complex Numbers.
questions.answer: Complex Numbers: Polar/Rectangular Forms Real Axis Imaginary Axis ℜ𝑒𝑒𝑧𝑧= 𝑥𝑥 ℑ𝑚𝑚𝑧𝑧= 𝑦𝑦 Rectangular: 𝑧𝑧= 𝑥𝑥+ 𝑗𝑗𝑗𝑗 𝑧𝑧 Polar: 𝑧𝑧= 𝑟𝑟𝑟𝜙𝜙 𝜙𝜙 𝑦𝑦= 𝑟𝑟sin 𝜙𝜙 𝑥𝑥= 𝑟𝑟𝑐𝑐𝑐𝑐𝑐𝑐𝜙𝜙 𝑟𝑟= 𝑥𝑥2 + 𝑦𝑦2 Prelab assignment #1: verify the equivalency of rectangular and polar forms A complex number can be represented as a point on a plane, called the Complex

text_preview: as a point on a plane, called the Complex Plane. The line from the origin of the plane to that point is similar to a 2D vector, with x and y components. Therefore, as in 2D vectors, a complex number c...

questions.question: What is Complex Plane?
questions.answer: as a point on a plane, called the Complex Plane.

questions.question: Define Therefore.
questions.answer: Therefore, as in 2D vectors, a complex number can be expressed in Cartesian (rectangular) or polar form.
